titleStmt.title: To get the final lit of songs
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: Manuscript, heavily revised, of "To Get the Final Lilt of Songs," which was first published in the April 16, 1888 issue of the New York Herald under the title "The Final Lilt of Songs." It was later included, under its final title, in the "Sands at Seventy" annex to the so-called deathbed edition of Leaves of Grass (1891â€“92).

text.body:
pub in Herald April 16 '88
Sine qua nonTo go the realfinal lilt of songs
To get the realfinal lilt of songs,
To know‸penetrate and read the intimatelore of poets—to readknow
the mighty ones,
Homer and Eschylus, Dante and Shak-
spere, Tennyson, Emerson,;
To diagnose the shifting⹀delicate tints‸—the human soul, its love and pride—*—to truly
understand—sine qua non,
Old age, and what it brings, andfrom all
its past experiences.
—to message all, theTo encompass these, then utmost scope‸—the price——the and judgementand tally,price of thementrance⹀price,
* The last keen factulty,
